creator: N/A
headline: N/A
abstract:
The Hesse site belongs to the ICOS network and to the french ORE Forêt. It is equipped with an eddy covariance systems above the canopy (on a 35m height tower) measuring continuously the net CO2, water vapour and sensible heat exchanged with the atmosphere. A important set of sensors (temperature, radiations, humidity,...) is also installed to describe the meteorological and soil status above and inside the canopy. In parallel, a specific instrumentation and manual inventories allows the following of the biomass growth and phenology. All these measurements recorded since 1997 constitute a unique dataset available on demand.
The Hesse site is located in the state forest of Hesse (Moselle, elevation 300 m). It is dominated by beech (Fagus sylvatica) at 90%. Other tree species are Carpinus betulus, Betula alba, Fraxinus excelsior, Prunus avium, Quercus petraea, Larix decidua. The understorey vegetation is very sparse. This plot was thinned during winter 1994/1995, 1998/1999 and 2004/2005 but LAI recover rapidly it’s initial value round 7.3. Trees are about 50 year-old. Low values of ground area (around 20 m2 ha-1) are characteristic of young, frequently thinned plots. Soil is a gleyic luvisol (clay 22%, loam 70% and sand 8%). The pH of the top soil (0–30 cm) is 4.9 with a C/N of 12.2 and an apparent density of 0.85 kg dm–3. Water holding capacity was about 0.40 m3 m–3. Mineral soil is covered with mull type humus.
author: Christian Mougin
name: SOERE F-ORE-T : Hesse site
distributionInfo: Commission Regulation (EU) No 1089/2010 of 23 November 2010 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards interoperability of spatial data sets and services
